svcproc.title: CYLINDER HEAD
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11for numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: lf the discharge valve stop (15) was removed and must be replaced, a sealant such as Locktite Retaining Compound #75, must be applied to the stop and its corresponding bore in the cylinder head. Before applying the sealant, make certain that the press fit between the discharge valve stop outside diameter and the valve stop bore in the cylinder head is a minimum of .0013 inches (.033 mm) and a maximum of .0028 inches (.07112 mm). lf this fit cannot be maintained, a new cylinder head body must be used. Be sure to completely support the outside top of the cylinder head casting, while pressing in the replacement stops.

important.para: The cylinder head must be supported in a fashion that allows the machined head surface to be.parallel to the arbor press bed and perpendicular to the press ram. This is necessary to permit the discharge valve stop to be installed squarely in its bore and to minimize the possibility of "cocking".

step1.para: Install the discharge valve spring (16), discharge valve (17) and valve seat (18). Using a 9/16" Allen wrench tighten the discharge valve seat as specified in the Torque Chart.

Test for leakage by the discharge valve. Apply 100 psi (690 kPa) of air pressure through the cylinder head discharge port and apply a soap solution to the discharge valve and seat. A slight leakage in the form of soap bubbles is permissible. lf excessive leakage is found, leave the air pressure applied and with the use of a fiber or hardwood dowel and a hammer, tap the discharge valve off its seat several times. This will help the valve to seat and should reduce the leakage. With the air pressure still applied at the discharge port of the cylinder head, check for leakage around the discharge valve stop exposed on the top of the cylinder head casting. No leakage is permitted.

lf the unloader piston bushing (2) was removed, press in a new bushing following the same pressing procedures given in Step 1. The inside diameter of the unloader piston bushing must be between .7497 inches (19.0mm) and .7460 inches (18.9mm) after pressing.
Using a 3/8" Allen wrench install the unloader stop (11) and 0-ring (13) in the head. Tighten as specified in the Torque Chart.
Install the unloader piston (4) and 0-ring in the head so that the short stem of the piston rests on the unloader stop.

Install the unloader piston spring (5), small end first, on the stem of the unloader piston. Install the metal (copper) unloader gasket (6) so that it rests on the shoulder of the unloader cavity. Install the inlet valve seat on top of the unloader gasket with its beveled side visible. Make certain the large coils of the piston spring rest within the recess of the inlet valve seat on the side opposite the bevel. Install the inlet valve so that it rests on the beveled side of the valve seat.
Install the inlet valve spring (9) on the inlet valve stop (10) and install the stop in the head. Using a spanner wrench, tighten the inlet valve stop as specified in the TORQUE CHART.

Apply 100 psi (689.5 kPa) air pressure to the unloader port of the governor mounting pad and note Inlet valve is driven away from its seat. Using a soap solution, test for air leakage at the valve stop. No leakage is permitted.
